summary: The Advanced Research Projects Agency for Health supports advanced biomedical and health research. It aims to create the next generation of treatments and cures to improve Americans' health and well-being. The agency, known as ARPA-H, faces two main challenges recruiting its scientific workforce: Competing with the private sector for specialized personnel A small talent pool of diverse candidates with the requisite experience To help, ARPA-H...
title: Biomedical Research: Strategic Workforce Planning Needed to Address Recruitment and Hiring Challenges at ARPA-H
